-4OAmZQn7Z8j4mCdKPFDsw.text: I went here on new years day, 07, and have to say, it was a spendid idea and a great pleasure to begin to year eating, dining and rinking at this place. From chalk farm road, you have to go up some steps, so it doesn't catch your eye immediately. You enter a long room, with lots of tables, and the range of cidar displayed along the walls. The food was amazing, most things seved with fries, but side dishes including creamy mash and much more. There are lots of fabulous (expensive I have to say, although worth it!) such as chicken in creamy white wine sauces and so forth. Delicious. This is a birlliant place to go to as a special treat, perfect for birthdays, anniversiries, or even just a date with your girlfriend. The cidar is lovely, all in all, it was the perfect place to spend my new years day.

zf4s6nJBhHWEOGgv52Wk-g.text: What a lovely place for dinner! No queues, friendly staff and great beer before being feasted with one of the best mussels selections one could find in London. Desserts however were average only. Haven't tried the rest of the menu yet, but will certainly do after I revisit the place.

C5DvFJVqt5Gx3DH-rwUuHQ.text: I took my Dad here for a birthday lunch during their 'Lobster Mania' promotion & it was excellent. They accommodated us though we arrived 5 minutes before the kitchen closed & we were the last in there. Maas lager really help the meal down as well!

LC5RxmMyPVmMse-kkS_Y8w.text: I remmeber back in 1992 when this place opened near me and we were all amazed at how moderna nd different it was. It's a testament to the owners of the palce that it still feels fun although I'd say the problem with it is that it's so clearly coorperate now perhaps lots of the fun has been taken out of it. At times the menu seems tired but they compensate with very reasonable deals. The lunch menu is probably the best bargain in town and its good for a quick snack before the Roundhouse.

AMk7CdITDry7CAXzSNtt_A.text: I simply cannot believe there is not a review already for Belgo Noord as it is simply amazing. Famous for its Moules et Frites, which are to say the least delectable ranging from simple Garlic and Wine sauce to a Tomato, Basil and Chritzo sauce. There are literally mussels for all occasions! The size of the portion that you receive is more than adequate and I always find it difficult to finish my accompanying chips! For the less adventureous amoungst you there is a large alternative menu form chicken to pasta, however,eating nothing but the mussels when I visit I can only comment on the fact that they look delicious. A must visit if you adore your mussels as much as myself!

ADp1HH5hkV_yU9fyeAFbnQ.text: had my going away to NYC dinner here many years ago. its changed since then, but still worth a cheeky visit for decent beer selection and inexpensive food. try dressing as a monk, too. you won't get a discount, but it might be fun, though a little draughty in winter.

W7d2PIggA37mnoDgp34BeA.text: I'm not sure I get all this Belgo's related fuss...its a bit blah if you ask me. Mussels dont really do it for me and the food I did order was borderline rubbish. Good selection of beers though. And it looks cool in here just not overly excited by the menu really. Bit try hard but seems to fail. May attempt another branch but wont go out of my way to do so.

PSMoJrs9NfATVcJ1WPSLJQ.text: Mussels are their specialty, and mussels are not my favorite. However, I was optimistic that they could win me over, mussels being their specialty an all. Sadly I thought the L'escargot mussels platter was just ok, nothing mesmerizing like the comprable dish I had at Savoir Faire. I sampled some of the Thai mussels and found these to be much better, though there was a bit too much lemongrass for my taste. The chips were tasty though, so I was content. Anyone who's a beer lover should enjoy the interesting selection here. I want to go back to try their fruit beers!

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom

FLdkz0L7ypZCkiTScCkiaw.text: I won't repeat any of Phil R's review (since I was there and all) but I agree with everything he said. I'm still salivating at the thought of my dinner last night. Gross?This is the perfect location for a pre-gig meal, especially if you get there before 7 for the special 'beat the clock' menu. The Roundhouse is just across the street; the Electric Ballroom is about an 8 minute walk down the road.Definitely worth the trip. I'd love to see what the other branches are like too.Oooh, also try their green beans. Yum!

HNueAeMPlyVT02AD1sYJUQ.text: Fantastic beer selection - something for every palette. Really accommodating staff. Unfortunately,  just missed out on Beat the Clock but brilliant deal to keep in mind next time we're up that way...

JjiZDOW1LiBfUKVfLvr2Eg.text: On a saturday afternoon visit to Belgo's in Camden, I ordered moules and frites in a Thai sauce - the flavours were good and the moules cooked well, however, the moules didn't smell very fresh and that fishy smell kinda put me off the dish and I couldn't finish it. The frites weren't great and the sauce on my boyfriend's steak was overly salty (presumably to make you buy more beer). Staff weren't amazingly friendly or worthy of the service charge either. Overall, a mediocre experience. Belgo's quality has declined considerably since my previous visit and I won't be going back in a hurry.

wjO3jjMnABTN8nSr40tRlg.text: love the atmosphere, the cool staff and even though the dishes sound to me very "uneatable" I enjoyed my meal every single time I have been there. It is usually busy but you will always find a table It is by far the best place in Camden you can have a decent meal in

XS5wQQrxUtBAyjW4p0rXoA.text: Tried to get in here once before on a Friday night but the place was absolutely packed, eventually managed to get in on a Tuesday evening. Beat the clock (from 5-7pm) basically involves choosing from about 4/5 dishes (all on their website) with the price being the time you place the order - order at 6.15 and it'll set you back £6.15. Food itself was surprisingly good - nice mussels, though could have done with some bread to mop up the sauce, and the chicken was great too. The belgian waffles for dessert were also delicious. Definitely one to visit again.

9gFnKSB-8qh4UOQn-mfpTg.text: Belgo's is a good quality but tiny little belgium beer palce situated by the Roundhouse in Camden.  They have a wide range of belgium beers, all served in their own glasses.  Go for the mort subite cherry beer, also known as the kiss of death, or my fave the Kwak, which comes in some bizarre wooden contraption and is around 9%.The bar area is complimeted by a nie restaurant which serves some great dishes including mussels which usually i can't stand but here i'm okay.  Great croquettes as well.  Perfect place for anyone going to see a show across the road who want to sample some good beers and well made food.

Gbhl5foJZ2Ri_hRHAuTq4g.text: Been here a few time and the food has always been delicious!The last time I was here I had the mussels Florentine which is basically mussels with creamed spinach and bacon grilled with Gruyere cheese! yummy! £9.50 a kilo!I also had a small glass of their finest beer Rochefort 10  but at Â£5.90 a glass you wouldn't really want to drink too many considering they are 3 euros in Belgium!

1F_lcYNm8UkctUk2JlKMKw.text: We ate here back in 2004 with some friends and it is one of my most memorable meals. The food was great and the planks of flavored genever were just out of control. I think we spent more on planks than our plane ticket to come over.

tZPX_apBVmK9mkC0shfbkQ.text: You really can't go wrong with their beat the clock deal. Great lager, lovely food, nice service and this one has awesome bendy tables downstairs. Love it.

Gc4V9nG85IG5PBGGohrVLg.text: Steaming tureens of mussels,good Belgian beer and generous special offers keep Belgo Noord busy in Camden. Whenever I eat there I can never get enough of the genial hum of conversation due to satiated palates of many happy diners. There is a high turnover of tables due to the speedy service.Belgo Noord is actually famed for its Crustacean diet but I was overwhelmed by the half a kilo of Moules Classique done in a garlicky white sauce which had quite a kick to it. Then we tucked into a somewhat unusual smoked bacon, duck, black pudding and lentil salad. The flavours of the salad were earthy and pungent. The main dishes of the restaurant are robust and generally meaty affairs almost all being done in beer.For once in my life I resisited the temptation of eating a huge portion Haddock and Chips cooked in Hoegarden Batter and tore instead into a beautiful tender Lamb Shank with Red Cabbage braised in Raspberry Beer and chunky Pork cutlets cooked in a delicious creamy Apple Beer and Mustard sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom. red cabbage

PVHVAstS9-CKB4GA7ZYvew.text: I went here recently and had a very good lunch. It is located near to The Camden Roundhouse. From the outside it does not look very promising, but once you get to the actual dining area you find yourself in a modern setting. In the evening the waiting staff dress as trappist monks,definitely different! the place is very spacious with the tables set so you don't feel too cosy with your neighbours.There are two parts to the restaurant..one has an airier feel and the other feels more under ground and cave like which is accentuated by the etched stone walls The food was very good and the service was quick. The staff were helpful and friendly. They also specialise in beers from Belgium and have a wide variety. They also sell more familiar beer should you decide that the Belgium stuff is not for you,an acquired taste for sure.There are also wines and soft drinks,not crazy about the wines they lack character but the food makes up for it.

DYIx_woq-VZcsH3SGi9rmw.text: Belgo is London's chain of Belgian restaurants. The welcoming staff will make up for their cold decor .Their menu is basic but offers quality rotisserie and mussels.One good thing is that you can actually see the chefs cook the food you're ordering.If you're new to this, check out their Beat the Clock offer (between 5 and 7pm), which is the best marketing concept I could have thought of: pay for the price at the time you order, i.e. order at 5pm, pay 5 pounds, 5.30pm, pay £ 5.50, etc They also have an interesting lunch menu for about £ 6. Their best venue is Belgo Noord in Camden/Chalk Farm, where you can just drop in and get a table, contrarily to Belgo Centraal, which often requires advance bookings due to its touristy location (Covent Garden).

7a0__l9ki901cK2aW4tMmw.text: The Belgo branch in Chalk Farm has two separate areas. The bar, where you can taste the beers and order some snacks and the restaurant. The restaurant is quite big and has a lot of tables. They serve Belgian food and an amazing range of beers (including some difficult ones to find outside Belgium like the Faro beer). They are specialized in mussels but they also offer other typical Belgian specialities. I recommend as a dessert the beer ice cream that is really surprising.The prices are not very cheap but average but I think it is a good value for money.

LeNmyoCjcCeOUupXKJ8tmQ.text: Great mussels.  Nice atmosphere.  You have to try the Poivre mussels and the red cabbage.  Both excellent.  They do automatically add service to the bill though or it would be a five star for me!

v05fFLobtdii1Kf_Tf__KA.text: On the outside opposite the roundhouse the facade of the restaurant looks subtle, quiet and unassuming although the real excitement begins when ascending the stairs into the main restaurant. What is very distinctive are the sounds and wonderful aroma's that are leaping out from the kitchen. At the top of the stairs is a perfect view of the kitchen and its mechanics below that are busy working away as you wait to be seated. There are two distinct parts to the restaurant, the right hand side with a cave esque style quality, that is more intimate and secluded, with the left side divided by a wall has a high ceiling a swathes of light flooding in from the glass roof above. The architecture aside, the food is amazing, so is the wonderful and colourful collection of beers and ales. The surf and turf, lobster and crab along with the muscles are all due a special mention. The quality of food is also unbelievable when you consider some central London prices. The only downside I can think of is the lack of parking.

iwWinCxwrF2V-ZPT_zXmwQ.text: Like other Belgo chains, Belgo Noord didn't disappoint. Great food and drinks option. However, my last star is reserved for Belgo Centraal where the downstairs, industrial, private club-like atmosphere can't be beaten by the Noord's modern redesign.

7_GIWJySWcINGoMdFcHiDg.text: Cheap, they do bargin lunches, great mussel & fries. Lovely

ggf001H33GnSagT9MZgeVw.text: It is tucked in the middle of the camden lock market and is famous for it moules et frites. Lots of lunch special deals and amazing choice of belgium beer. Their strawberry beer was strangely refreshing and titilates the taste buds. The desserts are utterly rich but worth the extra calories

ucY4_UUBUW-E-6rBn3fmwA.text: Love the 'beat the clock' offer that runs between 5-7pm. From a select menu you pay the amount showing on the clock. If you order at 6pm, you pay £6. I keep going back to BN because I am addicted to the Belgian beer. It is like liquid gold oozing down my throat. Both the £4.80 and £3.75 varieties are amazing. Fruit beer makes me such a happy boy.P.s. Be careful if they offer you bread - they charge for it.

yYW8CGLjGt25v6k6AIbwFw.text: Mega disappointed by this place.I had the seafood bowl (squid, mussels, salmon..) and was extra disappointed. Nothing ruins an experience like chewy seafood and mediocre moules.However...the salmon was EXTREMELY good, which was odd considering the subpar quality of the other fishies in my dishies.The sauce it was steeping in almost had me sleeping in. Erm. I'd only come back for their happy hour, because the dinner prices are not worth it at all for the quality of the seafood.More like "Belgo NOO"

fM1HiPxO63_r2HivqkRsDQ.text: Had a bottle of Prosecco and snacked on some chips here at the bar. It was a gorgeous day and they had he sliding doors open. The bartender was super friendly and gave great service. I would definitely go back and try the restaurant.

SIu-c34TXkhMVV9u65sSOQ.text: Visited this restaurant on a Friday evening for dinner and drinks. I had previously heard many good reviews of this place, especially the famous selection of beers and the mussels.There were a group of 10 people which posed no problem to the waiting staff who were very friendly and accommodating, even allowing one of my friends to change her food order after we had placed it.For those of you who like me are not big beer drinkers there is a nice selection of wines and soft drinks. I took the chicken which was tender and accompanied with a rich mushroom sauce, the fries could have been more crispier but at the price of £6.30 who can complain. They run a special Belgo Hour menu reducing the cost of mussels and other dishes listed to the time you place your order. Example if you order your food at 6:30 you would pay £6.30 and so on. The inside of the restaurant was open and quite modern.This will definitely be a place i intend to visit for after work food and drinks.

oljh6Z3iQoRgyreA99Wfnw.text: Nothing can beat, beating the belgo clock.But i went for their Lobsterfest.the minute you enter the restaurant you pass over the kitchen, and the smells rising up only further your anticipation.My cousin and I both ordered the Surf and Turf, and I might have had too much but I regret nothing. After dinner we thought it might be a good idea to order one of those boards of shots, and it was definately a good decision. This meal anywhere else would have cost so much more, and you wouldn't feel as comfortable, b/c you'd have to behave and pretend you are a grown up, but Belgo feels sturdy and unbreakable.

EAuFnkOjJEJgt8lwoU19PQ.text: Always bugged I can never do 3 1/2 stars... imagine this as a very high 3 stars. Anyway, I went here last night with some friends for dinner as I was curious to what Belgian food may imply. Well, I'm not a big mussels fan but I had half rotisserie "Belgo beer and apple sauce" chicken which was very tasty. (Although literally served with warm apple sauce, I had expected it to be a 'beer and apple' sauce.) The frites served with it were unfortunately quite average, and the prices just slightly more than I'd like, but I think everyone enjoyed their meals. The only thing I didn't have, and I feel sacrilegious for doing this, is beer. They have a fantastic selection of Belgian beers with half decent prices, and that probably would have stood to add another star to my review! Worth a peek, and could be a nice (and fun) dinner date.

TikS9oty7J48Jmq38YPSaw.text: Four words: Thai green curry mussels.I lived and worked up the street from this branch of the Belgo empire, and beat the clock had to be the best money-saver I could have asked for.  They used to have a really gorgeous [and alcoholic] fruity beer called K8, but sadly it's no longer on the mile-long beer menu.  This restaurant is truly one of the main reasons I long to return to London these days.The frites are always double-fried to perfection, the rye bread and butter is divine, and the mussels...ohhh the mussels.  Always served perfectly.It gets loud at night, but for those who are in the neighbourhood mid-afternoon/early evening, I highly recommend it.

FlmzCyYHBJk414oe2UOjxQ.text: I attended a Bloggers Lobster Quiz night at Belgo last night at Belgo Noord. I ate plenty of delicious lobster (and frites and waffles too!), drank a few different Belgian beers and generally had a very good time. I've been to Belgo Centraal (Belgo's mammoth Covent Garden location) on a number of occasions, but this was my first visit to their Chalk Farm restaurant. Opened in 1992, Belgo Noord was the first in the Belgo chain. I was pleased to see (and taste!) it's on par with the Covent Garden Belgo. The quiz itself was a blast. I learned all sorts of useful info about lobsters. Did you know the lobster's preferred sexual position is missionary? Well, ya do now. It was a smart way to introduce Lobsterfest (all through June) as well. I reckon if you're looking for an affordable opportunity to make a mess cracking into a yummy creature - Belgo's the best value for money option in town. My general experience has been that the Belgo restaurants do a bang up job ensuring a decent meal, an impressive range of great beer and an overall pleasant - if kinda hokey - casual dining experience. It's worth noting that with its large tables, high ceilings and somewhat open planned seating area, the venue was conducive for last night's event (there were about 20 of us). Keep it in mind.

BZuJtoeZmphqqE_PeNTKSQ.text: I too went to the launch of the Belgo June lobsterfest last night. I went to this restaurant about six months after it opened back in the early 90s (I lived in Camden Town at the time) and its rather more slick and trendy than I remember it back then! The food is typical Belgian fayre - rather unsophisticated but very tasty of course, and these guys would put any bar in Brussels to shame in terms of the selection of Belgian beers that they have available. It's definitely a beer-lovers heaven... My review (along with some pics) is here: londoneer.org/2011/06/be…

gLYYcVHF33Cd9qHyw_nyJg.text: Beat the clock said the waitress. I initially thought she was asking me to leave :-) Not at all, she responded with quizzical European eyebrows, you pay for the exact time ordered pre 7pm. Mai oui I reposted and opted for half a kilo of the green Thai mussels in an ambitious move, as sometimes I am allergic to mussels - they send me rather doolally and give me heart palpitations. In another feat of daring decision-making, I opted for (or rather I was given) a Floris framboise beer, which translates to a raspberry beer. This would not be exciting for the average girl, however did I not mention that I have never consumed a pint in my life! Yes that's right, not at school, uniall night rave, never. Until now, and I have a secret confessionthe fruity variety I rather like. Ssssh don't tell anyone :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom

l9Ldyk8vJQdl-zSij2h4gw.text: Heaven for Belgian beer lovers. The space is cool and I enjoyed the sausage and mash lunch special. Portion was just right for lunch and it included a beer for £7.95

ZUXI7HYKQfX_qo7c1PcnYg.text: I know everybody thinks Belgo is a bit naf now, but I remember when we were kids and it first opened and we were all completely blown away by it as a concept. Chips and mussels? Heaven. Monks? Amazing. And now that I am older, I can fully appreciate the extensive list of Belgian beers.The restaurant hasn't changed much since it first opened- the atmospheric interior is characterised by dark, curved and high glass ceilings. The open plan kitchen allows you to watch your food being prepared and the waiters still dress up in traditional monks' habits. The Beat the Clock menu is still incredibly good value- between 5.30 and 7pm, you pay for the time that you arrive and get to choose between moules frites, a burger, sausages and mushroom.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom

wMSSHDMr-3_jyWd_yXrB5Q.text: There is something slightly surreal and uncomfortable about being served beer and mussels by a man wearing what looks like a Scream Halloween outfit without the mask.  Turns out it was a monks outfit, but in the pretty much religiously devoid borough of Camden it just seemed a bit creepy.  It's nice that monks make beer and stuff, but I don't want a fake monk serving me beer, it's just weird.I suppose it's my own fault for going to Belgo's, apparently famous for their mussels and monk brewed beer, and to be honest, the fake monk waiter was very knowledgeable (about beer and monks) and very nice if a little strange.  The kilo pot of mussels mariniere with chips was also lovely and very reasonable at £12.50 and I had a Cristal beer which tasted a bit flat, but then I'm not a connoisseur. However, if you are, this is the place to go.  There is an obscene selection of beer and the monks are desperate to talk about what they are and where they come from.  They have fruit beer, chocolate beer, honey beer, white beer, amber beer, dark beer, pretty much the beer beyond your wildest dreams.  I would say though, if you do 'just fancy a pint' Belgo's is a little too clinical and serious for a casual drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom

weqFb8o-zeU6XVEtds0Sag.text: I had a great meal previously at Belgo Centraal, so I knew what I was in for when I passed by this place during a stroll through Camden.  So glad we came for lunch!  They were pretty dead quiet for lunch on a weekday, which was a little awkward, but the food was worth it so we didn't mind.  Belgo always has great deals, and their Express Lunch is no exception - £7.95 for a main, and a drink (soft drink, small glass of wine, or half pint).  1/2 kilo of Provençal mussels later, and I was a very happy camper.  They are just so good!  The broth was lovely and filled with juicy tomatoes and garlicky herb flavor.  The frites were absolutely addictive, long after I got full I couldn't stop picking at them (no need for mayo, they are so hot and crispy and lovely that they need no help).  Service was a bit slow and the atmosphere was quiet for lunch, but for such a low price, this has to be one of the best lunch deals in the area!  I would come back anytime!

BaxYAGKZ0rouJxIMcnQo9w.text: Quality restaurant! I was here with my husband and we've had a lovely evening. The staff was very responsive and completed every single wish we had regarding the food or the seating. The food was delicious and it was definitely worth the drive to reach the place.

M6Jt7_QDyuXGakuWPRz8ag.text: Very lively and very busy. Great atmosphere and a great experience to dine. The food was good, but it wasn't anything out of this world. We had a great time dining & wining... the waiter as far as I can remember was pretty good... although they were distracted with how busy the restaurant got that we had to ask for the bill on several occassions. I would recommend people to try out at this restaurant!

n0HoBNaNmFBRIq-tol_GpQ.text: As everyone's said, the beat the clock deal can't be missed! There's really something for everyone on this deal: I do love the mussels (and at a steal of a price!) but I have several friends who agree to go here because of the wide variety of food on the menu. I've also had the Rosemary chicken, and it was well done and not dry. I have on good authority that the burgers are delicious as well.There are usually quite a few specials going on in terms of drinks as well--they celebrated Oktoberfest earlier this month with a huge blowout, I think it was 5 beers from around the world for £10. Check them out for special drinking times and offers, use them with the Beat-The-Clock offer, and it's an all around cheap win!

5-08SaYdt56yX6qrJ47DvQ.text: This simplistic Belgian establishment is fantastic for mussles.  If you don't like mussels, they do have other fare, but I wouldn't think then that this place is just right for you.  They have a number of sauces for you to chose from and they give you very generous portions so you won't leave hungry.  Had lunch there twice, was very good just wish you could order the lunch mussels in different sauces rather than the standard marinere cream, that' pretty much the only downside I can see. They serve a number of rare and unique belgian beers which are delicious (albeit a bit pricey) and if you go Mon-Thurs between 5-7 they have a beat the clock special so if you order at 6:30 your meal will cost 6.30 instead of 12, not too shabby for eating a bit earlier than usual!Yum yum, for sure my go to spot for mussles in London (they also have a location on Clapham High Street fyi)

v0tXCGt5nvFQ-IEhkvZ-Dw.text: Absolute quality.Let me elaborate...'Mussels tonight. Yes.,' came the text.'Ok,' I typed as quickly as I could.'Where?' I was thinking.Look at the top of this page for the address, and then get excited.Belgo is so much more than just a place that serves mussels, but, being their speciality, they are pretty special. Whether they be creamy or winey or tomatoey or thats-not-even-a-word-y, they are huge, plentiful and gorgeous. And with their quirky, fun 'Beat the Clock' promotion from 5-7pm on weeknights... cheap! They cost the time! Genius! (That's a saving of over £4 per bowl, fyi)Enough about the guns, there's so much more to Belgo than that. The interior is modern and has a showroom feel. The staff are super friendly and efficient and then menu is great. If you're not into seafood, there are other promotional offers, and their other speciality is beer. The range is enormous. Blonde beers, fruit beers, wheat beers... the lot. And, in their style of catering for all tastes, the wine list is pretty darn good, too. Oh, and don't even mention the dessert menu. I couldn't look for fear of getting sucked in.We paid £35 including service and that was for two meals and a bottle of wine. You can't say fairer than that. Admittedly, it'll be more expensive on the weekend without the aforementioned weeknight promotion, but I'll definitely be going back. And back again. It's just awesome.Bel...go?Wel...come!

m796BdDm_rYhMlr9smf1NA.text: The most gorgeous juicy perfect mussels and excellent selection of beers. I have been going to Belgo in Chalk farm since the 90s and it is so impressive that they maintain the standard in all these years! Perfect lunch while in Camden!

S3e12RBE1LfZW-2XPOogHQ.text: I'm sat in the downstairs enjoying a couple of beers under the guise of a "client meeting" and I must say it's rather nice. We're on our 3rd Belgium beer and all its lovely. Please note I feel a little pissed while writing so apologies for the potential grammar or spelling errors in advance. We haven't ordered any food on this occasion but I have eaten here quite a few times before and the food is very good. I always opt for the mussels and chips but everything else does look good.This place does get buzzy of an evening especially at the weekends and I've always thought this place as a nice alternative in camden.I've been told by friends that they also do a yard of ale here but I don't think it's a good look at a meeting so won't ask right now to confirm.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom. Beer anyone?
Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom

7ouTeNNavysZ1_hUqf9ekA.text: We came here for dinner and had a really dismal experience.  We were a party of 9, including children.  We ordered chicken wings, fried calamari and garlic shrimps for starters.  The chicken wings were ok, but at £6.50 for 5 wings, they were way overpriced.  Calamari coating was hard and flavourless.  Garlic shrimps were small and overdone but flavour was good.  We ordered 3 different types of these famous mussels.  I appreciate that mussels will be smaller, at this time of year but they were small and some were not very fresh.  The flavours for all 3 pots were good.  The mushroom burger was enjoyed by my sister.  My daughter had the pork belly and she said the veg and mash were lovely.  The service wasn't very good.  We had to spend 5 minutes flagging our server down and I eventually got up to pay instead of waiting for our bill.  To get to the washrooms, you have to go past the kitchen pass.  This isn't really ideal, for diners to be walking past everybodies food.Definitely very poor value for money(regarding the food) and not great food.  I think it's more of a drinking place as the food is way overpriced and not of a good quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom burger with salad
Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom. Garlic and herb mussels
Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom. Kids 1/4 roast chicken with salad

G9l_6dNprnjEL2T_vxFQxg.text: Belgo never fails to impress me. They have such a great selection of menu to suit everybody and at such a reasonable price. Of course you can't miss the fact that they have over 50 types of beer to choose from. My favourite is always the peach beer. You can almost always get a table. I tried to book on a Saturday many times and managed to get a table for peak dinner times.Despite service has always been up to standard. This timeI was treated rudely by a particular staff. I assume he was in a managerial position as he wasn't wearing uniform. We waited over 30 minutes for our main course and when I asked him politely to check my order. He replied "it will be ready when its cooked" and walked away. I wasn't impressed. They have recently launched a seasonal lobster menu which was really delicious. I tried the Lobster soup which had crab meat and mussells in it and it was heaven. would be perfectly if it came with a roll.My all time favourite mussell dish is the snob - mussells in lobster sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom. Snob
Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom

IDM7Xzz5xtKPR1ibAFVViA.text: This place is fantastic! They have a roster of beer choices, at a very reasonable price! The food is very tasty, and appealing to the eye.Can come in groups or even a romantic day out.MUST try : Peach beer                                         Muscles (lobster flavour)                            or                     Beef ribs

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom. Peach Beer. A must try!
Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom. Beef ribs.
Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom. Mussssseeelllsss!

4N7DyrknSdY0Q7HynIO3rg.text: We've been visiting the Belgo chain for years.  The food (especially the mussels) and beer are outstanding.  It's pricey but we've always felt it was worth it.  But this last visit to Belgo Noord may have lost me as a customer.  Our waiter was not very attentive.  It wasn't all that busy yet it took quite some time for the initial drink order then after some time with an empty glass, I had to flag someone down for a second beer.  He would disappear for long stretches without checking in on us.  Then to make matter worse, they automatically included a tip in the bill.  That explained a lot.  He was clearly getting his tips whether he provided good service or not.  I don't think the chain as a whole is like this but I'm not sure I'd go back to find out.

GVWtkm2zYp4BU5Va-3NwPw.text: Admittedly here using a TimeOut offer which was a reason £10 for a kilo bucket of moules, fries and a beer. We were having a quick bite before the Roundhouse, which is conveniently just across the road from Belgo.I never know what the balance of food and service is, but first impressions count right? I guess having a printed out voucher on an already swamped evening with a queue of customers, isn't really a yay situation for the manager. However, the welcome was err not welcomed. When booking, I was reminded that it is 1 bucket, 1 fries and 1 drink.. I was aware of this, thank you. Fine print is my forte. At the venue, I was again reminded, and the waiters (dressed as monks?) buzzed around us confused about if we knew about the fine print.Finally we put our order through, my guest orders an extra fries and a beer. We went for the traditionelle kilo moule which consists white wine, celery, garlic and onion. The mussels were cooked well, and the sauce was how I . The chips lacked the crispiness in bite that Belgian double cooked ones should have. The beer selection looked good, and yes I will be back in the future, but not that branch. Service really lacked, especially as I had booked early in advance, let them know it was the deal voucher that I would be redeeming. Mussels do not take long to cook. I had let them know on the phone, in person and during the ordering that there was show we were going to see, albeit it across the road.I hate to rush a meal - I like to take my time, savour the flavours, sip my drink and chat... So food wise, I may visit another branch and give them a second chance.. but with this branch, beware of the peak times, even if it is a weekday, the service is lacking. Wonder if anyone can solve the monk-like waiters mystery for me?

uKzMROTloymtKyi06Y5UVA.text: Excellent service and good food. I had the chili lime chicken which was yummy, three person I was with had the streak which I would choose next time. The lobster looked awesome but neither of us are fans. Great selection of beer. I had a kwak which comes in a round flask on a wooden stand and is delicious. Going to go again, excellent for dates and mates alike.

36QiuF6JSUfaH9DH_Z4Gyw.text: Pretty poor experience all round. Came for a meal before a show at the Roundhouse. Service was slow and food was mediocre at best. Would not recommend going for food, Belgo seems more like a place you would go for a few drinks rather than a proper meal. Overpriced too.

Q2nE6-bMOi-XHmwRybAFsA.text: Once you've finally decided which beer to try you then need to choose what it's going to wash down. Belgo is famous for it's moules and there are a lot of versions to choose from. Kilo pots, platters or bowls. Marinière, Thai, deep fried in Japanese breadcrumbs, in a rich lobster, Champagne and cream bisque and so on. They also have five types of rotisserie chicken (£10.95), basted in Belgo's secret spices, which Zoe and I both went for. Zoe had her's with roast tomato, chorizo & herbs and I had the sticky chilli & ginger version.James had a big fancy lunch so, out of character, he opted for a salad of Confit Duck, soft boiled egg, smoked lardons and black pudding with giant croutons and Mark ordered the Pork Belly with Belgo apple sauce, buttered spinach and stoemp mash. Antonia turned up late and ordered the smaller version of James's salad, some frites and Gruyère croquettes, served with Belgo beer relish.As well as a couple of beers we splashed out a Schnapps shot stick, which you can see hanging behind the bar in various sizes from a 4 shot stick to one capable of holding 32, working out to about £2 a shot. We ordered the 24 shot stick, which was too long for our table! The sticks come with a range of flavours, apple, peach, cranberry, cherry and something orange that was disgusting!

9w4W_rmCo7oGBkAN2m-nFQ.text: I never really eat mussels. I mean, I've had them a few times and enjoyed, but they wouldn't necessarily be the first thing I ordered off the menu.Well, Belgo Noord is all about the mussels and the smell was enticing me so I had the traditional mussels cooked in garlic and white wine with celery and onion. Basic? Yes. Delicious? Absolutely! They came with fries which were great for soaking up the excess sauce. Took me a while to get through the whole kilo pot but by golly I was determined!Some of my friends got a starter and a half-kilo pot to mix things up a bit but theirs didn't come with fries so you have to order separately (or irritate your hardcore kilo-pot friends by stealing theirs!) The restaurant is suitably big for the after-theatre crowd they draw from the Roundhouse, yet we had pre-booked a table so no worries there. The waiters were friendly, attentive and one in particular had great banter about him and was flirting away with a friend of mine. She gave as good as she got while the rest of us were far too busy face-in-mussels to pay them any attention! A simple and reasonably-priced meal and a very handy stop off after a performance at the Roundhouse. I would certainly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom

CGK2tCZ01t90KuReDHSt3g.text: Great place to eat,fantastic beer choice.mussels are delivered daily.It has a whole charm to it:-))))

b4Q2g_QGrXA8a2nJkyAQSA.text: *Disclaimer: This review is based solely on the "Express Lunch" specialSolid place for dine-in lunch, on-the-go.As a London chain of Belgian restaurants, they run a lunch special for 7.95 pounds, which includes half pint of Belgo Pils (or glass of wine, or soft drink), a main dish and side (I got traditional mussels with frites.) This was a very generous portion of food, although not exactly stand-out material.Also ordered half pint of Belgo's Leffe Blonde - sweet and smooth as expected - both easy to drink.

1PhFxbGh3ZQMQQNN0Mmu3Q.text: If you are looking for somewhere to eat mussels in London the Belgo is the place to go.  They do other dishes too if you want to go with a non mussel lover.  There is a large selection of Belgian beers too.  The staff wear traditional Belgian outfits, which makes them look a bit quirky.  The prices are reasonable and they offer a lunch express menu for £7.95 with a drink and in the evenings they do beat the clock where you pay the price of the time you order.  They have a few different selections of mussels and other dishes, but if you are ordering from the discounted menus then the selections are smaller.  This branch is located in Camden, so handy if you come to scour the Market or you work in the nearby area.  They also have another couple of branches in London, which are more central.

5EzzUCtJC_q-MsT2OXby2g.text: Service was exceptionally polite and friendly.  Food was tasty, but portions slightly small and somewhat expensive.  Would return.

a1idV4VOIXEteChOIXrhRw.text: Im seriously a sucker for a good server and ours was a classic. Super funny and entertaining. The manger woman on the other hand... not so entertaining. Anyway...A friend and I stopped by here on a weekend afternoon for lunch. I mean... its Belgian. Who eats at a Belgian restaurant (besides Belgian people... in Belgium)? We had to test the waters. So glad we did. I valiantly attempted to down a kilo of the Thai mussels... plus frites... plus Belgian ale. I made it 2/3 through the mussels and thought I was going to hurl. Its a lot of mussels, be warned. That said, they were great. Lots of Belgian beers on tap and in bottles. Really cool space with great architecture. Friend loved her slow-cooked beef stew. Nice place to relax on a weekend and have a beer (and a Belgian waffle dessert).

GOTt9ZvQJTCb8s9IrKAQCg.text: I love a little Belgo. Chains are often a good thing. They typically provide a certain consistency and quality. That is an admirable feat in my opinion. They often also provide good value for money, because a lot of the overheads and running costs are centralized... leaving a little more for lunch deals etc.I feel that Belgo is a good case for this.Although primarily known for the Moules Frites, I often choose the Spit Roast (that phrase always makes me think of Premiership footballers and girls of loose morals) Chicken sometimes with chili and ginger sauce, sometimes with the cream and mushroom sauce, always served with chips and a salad. It really impressive with it's bountiful quantity and tasty succulence. The decor is well thought out at Belgo Noord, and the light, airy feel puts it ahead of the Belgo Centraaaaaaaaaaal branch. Don't expect a quiet dining experience at Belgo - the open plan design adds up to a clattery experience.My first visit to Belgo Noord branch was at, of course a wonderful Yelp Event. Lobster Fest. Remember that? Well, as ever Yelp does it's job and brings me back over and over!

x_iCMZXHhkcTNLzQQzEtTw.text: Belgo: always a solid and satisfying option for moules frites and Belgian beers. I wouldn't recommend travelling so far north for it when you can get the same thing in a more central, lively location, specifically at the Belgo in Covent Garden.But the comedic value of sitting under gigantic lettering that spells out ASSFACE, etched into the wall above you at the table in the corner (yelp.co.uk/biz_photos/l3…), well, that's worthy of an extra star, surely.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Noord - London, United Kingdom. assface

oBSX5RLX3sg5nbAtYPzJCA.text: 2.75 stars.  If nothing else, you can create an entirely new vocabulary from the somewhat questionable list of words that surround the dining area at Belgo Noord...The Beat the Clock special mentioned in Yelp reviews can be found on the back page.  There were only four choices, and only one option was moules (classic preparation).  That wasn't enough for me so I ordered the Snob which turned out to be mussels drenched in a flavorful pool of lobster bisque.  We also had the classic preparation which was a bit lacking in overall flavor to me, but more preferable to my dining companion.  The frites are thick cut and served with a rather sweet mayo dipping sauce.  Overall, the food was acceptable without being exceptional.  Given that two large halls separate the rather cavernous Belga Noord from its entranceway, it has an odd tucked away feel.  The place has a nice minimalistic yet modern look, however, it could stand to be a bit more lively.  My favorite part of the experience?  Creating Urban Dictionary meanings for words that randomly appeared in two lines over the dining area.  Let's just say that our new definitions for "slapjaw" and "paddlecock" probably should not be included in this Yelp review.  If you happen to be in Camden and in the mood for decent Belgian food, Belgo Noord is an acceptable option.

CCzaC1qp-bzEFR9qA23WOw.text: I have a TasteCard, and Belgo is one of the places that is 2 for 1 with it, so My boyfriend and i decided to give it a try. We called ahead, as we have to with the card, and gave them a heads up. The room its self is massive with half of it in a low ceiling alcove and the rest has a huge skylight giving it a very airy feeling.  It was a tuesday, so maybe there were expecting to not be busy, and being that they only had maybe a 3rd of the restaurant open, i guess they wernt. But in the hour that we were there the entire area filled. They only had a manager (who was a bit of a moron), a waiter (who was trying to keep up, and was doing his best) and a cocktail waitress (who was doing alot of standing around). The food itself was tasty, but the salads were drowned in dressing and our mains almost had more chips the actual substance. The Squid salad was rubbery and over cooked and but the duck salad was much better. I had the lobster and crab burger, but it tasted more like a generic, but good, crab cake. My boyfriend had the roasted chicken with ginger which was a bit dry. We had tickets to see a film, so we asked for the bill while we were still eating. It took them 20 min just to sort out the bill. Worth paying £20-ish. but i doubt i would go without a discount.

0tVxFQHK1Q3hfK_giFW_HA.text: A large group of us went for a birthday celebration. Excellent food, very good service. A little pricy, but worth it.
